section.title: FIFO Interface
section.para: The module allows dumping the current configuration as well as dispatcher list reloading via the FIFO interface.
There are two FIFO commands to use with dispatcher.

listitem.para: dispatcher.dump - dump the current dispatcher sets
dispatcher.reload - reload the dispatcher list text file

section.title: Dumping the current configuration
section.para: The command dispatcher.dump can be used to dump the currently deployed dispatcher list in the SER internal notation.

example.title: dumping the active dispatcher list
example.programlisting:
# sercmd dispatcher.dump flags: DI_MAX_SETS: 16 DI_MAX_NODES: 16 DI_MAX_URILEN: 256 Active dispatcher list: 0 Set '0' node 0 sip:10.1.1.1:5060 node 1 sip:10.1.1.2:5060 node 2 sip:10.1.1.3:5060 node 3 sip:10.1.1.4:5060 Set '1' is empty Set '2' is empty Set '3' is empty Set '4' is empty Set '5' is empty Set '6' is empty Set '7' is empty Set '8' is empty Set '9' is empty Set '10' is empty Set '11' is empty Set '12' is empty Set '13' is empty Set '14' is empty Set '15' is empty
End of dispatcher list #

section.title: Reloading the dispatcher list
section.para: The command dispatcher.reload can be used to update the dispatcher list while running SER.

example.title: Reloading the dispatcher list
example.programlisting: # sercmd fifo dispatcher.reload dispatcher list 1 activated #
